title: pairwise tests throw errors

labels.name: waiting to close
labels.description: Issue is solved, waiting for feedback.

body:
I ran into some errors trying to use the pairwise tests on the current releases (diffxpy v0.6.9 and batchglm v0.6.4). Here are some reproducible examples:

```python
# Setup
import diffxpy.api as de
import scanpy as sc

pbmc = sc.datasets.pbmc68k_reduced()
pbmc.X = pbmc.raw.X
```

Basic call:

```python
de.test.pairwise(pbmc, "bulk_labels")

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-2-7a4254601ce3> in <module>
----> 1 de.test.pairwise(pbmc, "bulk_labels")

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/diffxpy/testing/tests.py in pairwise(data, grouping, as_numeric, test, lazy, gene_names, sample_description, noise_model, size_factors, batch_size, training_strategy, is_sig_zerovar, quick_scale, dtype, pval_correction, keep_full_test_objs, **kwargs)
   1028         dmat = glm.data.design_matrix(
   1029             sample_description,
-> 1030             formula="~ 1 - 1 + grouping"
   1031         )
   1032         model = _fit(

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/batchglm/data.py in design_matrix(sample_description, formula, as_categorical, dmat, return_type)
     76             return dmat
     77         else:
---> 78             raise ValueError("return type %s not recognized" % return_type)
     79     else:
     80         if return_type == "dataframe":

ValueError: return type xarray not recognized
```

Using rank test:

```python
de.test.pairwise(pbmc, "bulk_labels", test="rank")

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-c949f229aac9> in <module>
----> 1 de.test.pairwise(pbmc, "bulk_labels", test="rank")

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/diffxpy/testing/tests.py in pairwise(data, grouping, as_numeric, test, lazy, gene_names, sample_description, noise_model, size_factors, batch_size, training_strategy, is_sig_zerovar, quick_scale, dtype, pval_correction, keep_full_test_objs, **kwargs)
   1089                     is_sig_zerovar=is_sig_zerovar,
   1090                     dtype=dtype,
-> 1091                     **kwargs
   1092                 )
   1093                 pvals[i, j] = de_test_temp.pval

/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/diffxpy/testing/tests.py in two_sample(data, grouping, as_numeric, test, gene_names, sample_description, noise_model, size_factors, batch_size, training_strategy, is_sig_zerovar, quick_scale, dtype, **kwargs)
    893             grouping=grouping,
    894             is_sig_zerovar=is_sig_zerovar,
--> 895             dtype=dtype
    896         )
    897     else:

TypeError: rank_test() got an unexpected keyword argument 'dtype'
```
